triples.evidence: Deep radiomics takes things one step further. Instead of manually extracting features, we use convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to learn them directly from the image data.
These learned features are then encoded and passed to classifiers for prediction tasks, such as distinguishing between tumor subtypes or predicting patient outcomes.
In this workflow, random patches from images are used to train a CNN to recognize tumor regions.
Deep radiomics takes things one step further. Instead of manually extracting features, we use convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to learn them directly from the image data.

concepts.term: Deep radiomics represents the cutting edge-combining the statistical rigor of radiomics with the power of deep learning to capture complex image biomarkers.

evidence: Deep radiomics represents the cutting edge-combining the statistical rigor of radiomics with the power of deep learning to capture complex image biomarkers.
